title: 109_hr631
content: The "Pascua Yaqui Mineral Rights Act of 2006" defines key terms such as Secretary, State, and Tribe. It also addresses the acquisition of subsurface mineral interests. The Secretary, in coordination with the Attorney General and with State consent, shall acquire subsurface rights in specific tribally-owned parcels in Pima County, Arizona through eminent domain within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary will acquire subsurface rights in specific tribally-owned parcels in Pima County, Arizona through eminent domain within 180 days of the Act's enactment. This includes Lots 1 through 8 in sec. 14, T. 15 S., R. 12 E., and various other parcels in the Salt River Base & Meridian area. The Secretary will pay the State for the acquisition of subsurface mineral interests based on market value determined by a mineral assessment, negotiation between the State and Tribe, or an appraisal report if agreement cannot be reached. The Secretary will acquire subsurface mineral interests after payment to the State, termination of all other parties' rights, and approval by the Office of the Special Trustee for American Indians. The Tribe agrees to reimburse the Secretary for costs related to acquiring subsurface mineral interests. The market value of the acquired interests will be determined according to specific standards. The Secretary may impose additional terms and conditions for the acquisition. The Secretary may impose additional terms and conditions for the acquisition of subsurface mineral interests to protect the interests of the United States and any valid existing right. SEC. 4. INTERESTS TAKEN INTO TRUST. The Secretary shall take into trust for the Tribe the subsurface rights to specified parcels in Pima County, Arizona, excluding certain sections. The Tribe will pay transaction costs for the assessment, review, and transfer of subsurface rights in specified parcels in Pima County, Arizona. The House of Representatives passed the document on September 12, 2006, with Karen L. Haas as the Clerk.
